greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0, a(2n) = 1 + a(n), a(2n+1) = 1 + a(A064989(2n+1)); also binary width of terms of A156552 and A243071.
comment: a(n) tells how many iterations of A252463 are needed before 1 is reached, i.e., the distance of n from 1 in binary trees like A005940 and A163511.
Similarly for A253553 in trees A253563 and A253565. - _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 14 2019
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
formula: a(n) = A029837(1+A243071(n)). [a(n) = binary width of terms of A243071.]
a(n) = A029837(A005941(n)) = A029837(1+A156552(n)). [Also binary width of terms of A156552.]
example: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1,...,y_k) is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k), so a(n) is the size of the inner lining of the integer partition with Heinz number n, which is also the size of the largest hook of the same partition. For example, the partition with Heinz number 715 is (6,5,3), with diagram
o o o o o o
o o o o o o
both of which have size 8, so a(715) = 8.
